fixes.name: Median Sales Price National
fixes.solution_explanation: Converted Tableau MEDIAN([Price]) to DAX MEDIAN over the column 'trulia_dataset_cleaned (trulia_dataset_cleanedTBL)'[Price]. This is an aggregation, so it is implemented as a measure.

fixes.name: Median Sales Price % Increase
fixes.dax_expression: (MEDIAN('trulia_dataset_cleaned (trulia_dataset_cleanedTBL)'[Price]) - MEDIAN('trulia_dataset_cleaned (trulia_dataset_cleanedTBL)'[Last Sold For])) / MEDIAN('trulia_dataset_cleaned (trulia_dataset_cleanedTBL)'[Last Sold For]) * 100
fixes.solution_explanation: Translated the Tableau expression using MEDIAN aggregations into DAX by replacing each MEDIAN([Column]) with MEDIAN('trulia_dataset_cleaned (trulia_dataset_cleanedTBL)'[Column]). Because it uses aggregations, it is implemented as a measure.

fixes.name: County Drill Down
fixes.solution_explanation: Converted the row-level Tableau IF [State Set] THEN [COUNTYNAME] END into a DAX calculated column using IF on the row-level field 'trulia_dataset_cleaned (trulia_dataset_cleanedTBL)'[State Set], returning 'trulia_dataset_cleaned (trulia_dataset_cleanedTBL)'[COUNTYNAME] when true and BLANK() otherwise.
